intro: Inula conyzoides, commonly known as false sunflower, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Africa and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with yellowish-green foliage and bright yellow flower heads that resemble sunflowers. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and agricultural fields. The plant is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
